SEARCH

Package utilities

package utilities
Abstract Data Type (ADT) interfaces and small utility interfaces used by the project.

The utilities package declares the ADTs that the assignment requires students to implement. Interfaces in this package define the behavioural contracts (methods, preconditions, postconditions and expected exceptions) for concrete implementations in implementations. Important interfaces include:

  • ListADT<E> — generic linear list contract (add/get/remove/set/iterator/etc.).
  • Iterator<E> — simple forward-only iterator used by the custom lists.
  • StackADT<E> and QueueADT<E> — stack and queue contracts used by the parser.

The project follows a strict separation: the ADTs live in utilities and implementations live in implementations. Tests and driver code operate against the ADTs so that implementations can be swapped without modifying test code.

Since:
2025
Author:
Alexander Raagas, Minh Tam, Mrinal Jha, Noah Zschogner
  • Interfaces
    Class
    Description
    Iterator<E>
    This interface will provide an mono-directional iterator for any of the data structures that are specified in this package.
    ListADT<E>
    The ListADT interface is designed to be used as a basis for all the Linear data structures that will be developed in the CPRG304 F2025 class at SAIT.
    QueueADT<E>
    This is the professional Queue Interface for Object-Oriented Programming 3 (CRPG 304) at the SAIT Polytechnic.
    StackADT<E>
    This is the professional Stack Interface for Object-Oriented Programming 3 (CRPG 304) at the SAIT Polytechnic.
